      • isMP3HeaderComplete

        public boolean isMP3HeaderComplete()
        Description copied from interface: Decoder
        Informs whether parsed MP3 header data is enough to build the header of a WAV file.

        Current implementation returns false if mp3data_struct.getTotalframes() returns 0. For instance only MP3 files with Xing header save the number of MP3 frames contained. The total number of frames is used to calculate the data size in bytes of the PCM data to build a WAV file.

        Specified by:
        isMP3HeaderComplete in interface Decoder
        Returns:
        true if MP3 header is complete.
        See Also:
        Decoder.fixWAVHeader(String)

        protected static short[] correctSize(int samples,

      • writeWAVHeader

        public void writeWAVHeader(java.io.OutputStream output)
        Description copied from interface: Decoder
        Writes on the specified stream a WAV header with the information provided by the mp3data_struct object of this decoding task.

        Even though MP3 header data is not complete, the WAV header is written with incomplete information (PCM data size is 0). This WAV invalid header can be fixed later calling Decoder.fixWAVHeader(String) after the decoding task finishes.

        Specified by:
        writeWAVHeader in interface Decoder
        Parameters:
        output - the stream to write the WAV header.
        See Also:
        Decoder.isMP3HeaderComplete()

      • writeDecodedFrame

        public void writeDecodedFrame(PCMFrame frame,
                     java.io.OutputStream output)
        Description copied from interface: Decoder
        Writes the specified PCM frame to the specified stream.
        Specified by:
        writeDecodedFrame in interface Decoder
        Parameters:
        frame - the PCM frame to save.
        output - the output stream to write the frame.

      • fixWAVHeader

        public void fixWAVHeader(java.lang.String wavPath)
        Description copied from interface: Decoder
        Modifies the header of the specified WAV file fixing invalid data saved by Decoder.writeWAVHeader(OutputStream).

        You do not need this method if Decoder.isMP3HeaderComplete() returns true.

        This method must be called after this decoding task has finished (is closed).

        The value returned by Decoder.getPCMDataSize() is used to fix the WAV header.

        Specified by:
        fixWAVHeader in interface Decoder
        Parameters:
        wavPath - the path of the WAV file.
